description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Google Data Center Supplier Quality Manager, you evaluate product and workmanship quality requirements, designs, specifications, suppliers, production lines, quality assurance/control strategies, commissioning, integrators, logistics, assembly and operations to assure on-time delivery of our power, cooling and infrastructure control systems. Your team works cross-functionally internal teams to deliver more efficient and greener capacity globally with increasing predictability, low cost of poor quality and shorter lead times.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Industrial, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of quality management experience, of which 6 years managing a supplier quality team.
  • Experience managing product or services suppliers/vendors, conducting site audits/assessments.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in applying quality techniques such as Poka-yoke, SPC, 8D, Ishikawa, FMEA, and predictive analytics on manual production lines.
  • Experience in managing a wide ranging portfolio of suppliers in a mission critical design, build operate environment.
  • Excellent people management and communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead collaborative, cross-functional teams to review standardized, impactful quality metrics performance of supplier, general contractor and trades vendors. Address high priority risk areas based on both quantitative and qualitative assessments to reduce product complexity, shrink lead times, assure schedule integrity and decrease CoPQ impacts.
  • Inspire, grow, and optimize a global team of Supplier Quality Engineer professionals.
  • Drive efficient and impactful supplier production lines audits to reduce variability, improve predictability, streamline lead time, embed automatic reporting tools and improve output quality.
  • Statistically connect production line metrics and QA/QC audits/testing to field performance and efficiency.
  • Help converge back end information exchange with life cycle, cost, schedule and ERP tools.
title: Data Center Supplier Quality Manager
